Workspace Pane

 

The Workspace pane allows files, functions, global variables and class definitions of an ELF project to be displayed in a tree view.
The workspace pane has two views, selectable from the tabs at the bottom of the pane.

The first tab selects File View. This displays a tree view, containing the name of the project, and a list of all files in the ELF project that contain executable code.
The root of this tree shows a “Workspace” folder. This displays the name of the ELF project. All project files are displayed within this folder.
C++ & Header files are split into separate sub-folders while files with other extensions are placed in the root of the Workspace folder.

The second tab contains the Browse View. This is used to browse through all class types, global functions and global variables within the project. Each class contains sub-items for methods and static members.
Browse view contains 3 folders named Classes, Functions and Variables, which contain all class types, global functions and global variables respectively.

These folders may be expanded to look at the relevant lists. The class folder, when opened, displays all class definitions within the project. These may in turn be expanded to show a list of all methods and static member variables.

 

Right-clicking on any of the items displays a context menu. In addition to the standard pane management menu items, there are also ones to carry out operations specific to the currently selected item.

For File items, the context menu contains operations for opening the file in a new source pane, or opening the file in Visual Studio.

For Browse items, the context menu changes according to the type of item:

Global Functions and class methods

·         Goto Definition opens a new source pane and loads the source file containing the function and places the cursor at the start of the function, scrolling down the file if necessary

·         Edit In Visual Studio works in the same way as Goto Definition, but loads the source file into Visual Studio instead.

·         Run To.. starts executing the program, stopping inside the debugger when the programme counter reaches the start of the function.

·         Toggle a Breakpoint at the start of the function. The menu text alternates between Add & Remove breakpoint

 

Global variables & Class members

·         Hardware Breakpoint – Displays the hardware Breakpoint dialog box and fills in the VarName entry with the selected variables name.

 

All of these context menu items have user-configurable keyboard accelerators, which can be set from the Accelerators tab in the Settings menu.

 

Whatever the type item selected (except folders), the context menu will contain a Properties menu item (The menu text changes between “File” and “Browse Properties”).

This menu item will display a dialog box containing information about the selected item, such as full path/filename/last modified date for files, and type information for variables and classes.

The Properties dialog is a toggled window. That is, once the dialog has been opened, the context menu item will be ticked and the dialog will stay on the screen until either the context menu is selected again or the close button on the dialog is clicked. However, while the dialog is displayed the debugger continues to function normally and menus/toolbars are still accessible. When the selection changes in the workspace pane, the properties dialog will be updated to show the new selection.

 

In addition to the context menu, you can double-click on an item with the left mouse button. This will attempt to “Goto” the selected file or definition.

The keyboard may also be used to navigate around the workspace pane (up + down to change the items, left/right to collapse & expand, ENTER to simulate a double-click.

 

Hover Evaluation

Leaving the mouse over a Browse item in the workspace pane for a short time will attempt to evaluate the item. This will display the address and/or current value.
